verses.text_plain: For, behold, the Lord, the Lord of hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the staff, the whole stay of bread, and the whole stay of water,
verses.verse_html: 1For, behold, the Lord, the Lord of hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the staff, the whole stay of bread, and the whole stay of water,

verses.text_plain: The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient,
verses.verse_html: 2The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient,

verses.text_plain: The captain of fifty, and the honourable man, and the counsellor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.
verses.verse_html:
3The captain of fifty, and the honourable man, and the counsellor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator. ▼
▼ the honourable…: Heb. a man eminent in countenance
 , ▼
▼ eloquent…: or, skilful of speech

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the honourable…: Heb. a man eminent in countenance
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the honourable…: Heb. a man eminent in countenance
▼ eloquent…: or, skilful of speech

verses.text_plain: And I will give children to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.
verses.verse_html: 4And I will give children to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.

verses.text_plain: And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbour: the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient, and the base against the honourable.
verses.verse_html: 5And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbour: the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient, and the base against the honourable.

verses.text_plain: When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand:
verses.verse_html: 6When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand:

verses.text_plain: In that day shall he swear, saying, I will not be an healer; for in my house is neither bread nor clothing: make me not a ruler of the people.
verses.verse_html:
7In that day shall he swear, saying, I will not be an healer; for in my house is neither bread nor clothing: make me not a ruler of the people. ▼
▼ swear: Heb. lift up the hand
 , ▼
▼ healer: Heb. binder up

tokens.text: I will not be an healer

footnotes.body_text: ▼ swear: Heb. lift up the hand
footnotes.body_html: ▼ swear: Heb. lift up the hand
▼ healer: Heb. binder up

verses.text_plain: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen: because their tongue and their doings are against the Lord, to provoke the eyes of his glory.
verses.verse_html: 8For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen: because their tongue and their doings are against the Lord, to provoke the eyes of his glory.

verses.text_plain: The shew of their countenance doth witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom, they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have rewarded evil unto themselves.
verses.verse_html: 9The shew of their countenance doth witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom, they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have rewarded evil unto themselves.

verses.text_plain: Say ye to the righteous, that it shall be well with him: for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
verses.verse_html: 10Say ye to the righteous, that it shall be well with him: for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.

verses.text_plain: Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with him: for the reward of his hands shall be given him.
verses.verse_html:
11Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with him: for the reward of his hands shall be given him. ▼
▼ given…: Heb. done to him

footnotes.body_html: ▼ given…: Heb. done to him

verses.text_plain: As for my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they which lead thee cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths.
verses.verse_html:
12As for my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they which lead thee cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths. ▼
▼ lead…: or, call thee blessed
 , ▼
▼ destroy: Heb. swallow up

footnotes.body_html: ▼ lead…: or, call thee blessed
▼ destroy: Heb. swallow up

verses.text_plain: The Lord standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the people.
verses.verse_html: 13The Lord standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the people.

verses.text_plain: The Lord will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people, and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses.
verses.verse_html:
14The Lord will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people, and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses. ▼
▼ eaten: or, burnt

tokens.text: thereof: for ye have eaten up

verses.text_plain: What mean ye that ye beat my people to pieces, and grind the faces of the poor? saith the Lord God of hosts.
verses.verse_html: 15What mean ye that ye beat my people to pieces, and grind the faces of the poor? saith the Lord God of hosts.

verses.text_plain: Moreover the Lord saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet:
verses.verse_html:
16Moreover the Lord saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet: ▼
▼ wanton…: Heb. deceiving with their eyes
 , ▼
▼ mincing: or, tripping nicely

footnotes.body_text: ▼ wanton…: Heb. deceiving with their eyes
footnotes.body_html: ▼ wanton…: Heb. deceiving with their eyes
▼ mincing: or, tripping nicely

verses.text_plain: Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will discover their secret parts.
verses.verse_html:
17Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will discover their secret parts. ▼
▼ discover: Heb. make naked

footnotes.body_html: ▼ discover: Heb. make naked

verses.text_plain: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments about their feet, and their cauls, and their round tires like the moon,
verses.verse_html:
18In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments about their feet, and their cauls, and their round tires like the moon, ▼
▼ cauls: or, networks

verses.text_plain: The chains, and the bracelets, and the mufflers,
verses.verse_html:
19The chains, and the bracelets, and the mufflers, ▼
▼ chains: or, sweet balls
 , ▼
▼ mufflers: or, spangled ornaments

footnotes.body_html: ▼ chains: or, sweet balls
▼ mufflers: or, spangled ornaments

verses.text_plain: The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the earrings,
verses.verse_html:
20The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the earrings, ▼
▼ tablets: Heb. houses of the soul

tokens.text: and the ornaments of the legs

footnotes.body_text: ▼ tablets: Heb. houses of the soul
footnotes.body_html: ▼ tablets: Heb. houses of the soul

verses.text_plain: The rings, and nose jewels,
verses.verse_html: 21The rings, and nose jewels,

verses.text_plain: The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping pins,
verses.verse_html: 22The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping pins,

verses.text_plain: The glasses, and the fine linen, and the hoods, and the vails.
verses.verse_html: 23The glasses, and the fine linen, and the hoods, and the vails.

verses.text_plain: And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle a rent; and instead of well set hair baldness; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth; and burning instead of beauty.
verses.verse_html: 24And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle a rent; and instead of well set hair baldness; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth; and burning instead of beauty.

verses.text_plain: Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war.
verses.verse_html:
25Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war. ▼
▼ mighty: Heb. might

verses.text_plain: And her gates shall lament and mourn; and she being desolate shall sit upon the ground.
verses.verse_html:
26And her gates shall lament and mourn; and she being desolate shall sit upon the ground. ▼
▼ desolate: or, emptied: Heb. cleansed

footnotes.body_html: ▼ desolate: or, emptied: Heb. cleansed
